summary: Adds self‑loop edges to every node of a DGL graph and returns a new graph. Handles homogeneous graphs directly and heterogeneous graphs only for edge types where source and destination node types are identical, with an option to create a separate self‑loop edge type per node type. Supports removal of existing self‑loops to prevent duplicates and initializes self‑loop edge features either with a constant value or by aggregating incoming edge features using mean, sum, max, or min.
business_intent: Enhance graph data for graph neural network models by ensuring each node has a self‑connection and providing appropriate edge feature values, thereby improving message‑passing effectiveness and model performance.
